chapter.title: Examples
chapter.para: This chapter shows some practical examples of using UIML to create a user interface for your .Net application. The first example is the calculator example in section . The second example shows how a user interface for keeping track of different blog feeds can be created with UIML.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.para:
To give the reader an idea what a feed aggregate exactly does, here are some existing ones: Blam! and Straw are two execellent examples. This example tries to show it is easy to create a user interface that is loosely coupled with the application logic but still provides equal functionality as the aformentioned examples. To handle the RSS
Rich Site Summary parsing an external library will be used.

section.title: Structure
section.para:
The user interface for our Feed Aggregator is a simpliefied version of the user interface one can find for Blam! and Straw for illustration reasons.
Structure for the Feed Aggregator
<structure> <part class="Frame" id="fr"> <part class="HBox"> <part class="VBox"> <part class="Label"><style><property name="text">Recent Posts</property></style></part> <part id="articles" class="List"/> </part> <part class="VBox"> <part class="Label"><style><property name="text">Entry Title</property></style></part> <part id="title" class="Entry"/> <part class="Label"><style><property name="text">Entry Body</property></style></part> <part id="blogentry" class="Text"/> <part class="HBox"> <part id="update" class="Button"/> <part id="newpost" class="Button"/> <part id="quit" class="Button"/> </part> </part> </part> </part> </structure>
